\index{get\_models() (authenticate.apps.AuthenticateConfig method)@\spxentry{get\_models()}\spxextra{authenticate.apps.AuthenticateConfig method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{authenticate:authenticate.apps.AuthenticateConfig.get_models}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_models}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{include\_auto\_created}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{include\_swapped}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Return an iterable of models.

\sphinxAtStartPar
By default, the following models aren’t included:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
auto\sphinxhyphen{}created models for many\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}many relations without
an explicit intermediate table,

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
models that have been swapped out.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Set the corresponding keyword argument to True to include such models.
Keyword arguments aren’t documented; they’re a private API.

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{authenticate.models module}

\section{authenticate.urls module}
\label{\detokenize{authenticate:authenticate-urls-module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module defines the URL patterns for the authentication views.


\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{authenticate:get--login}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{GET~}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{/login}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Maps to the \sphinxtitleref{login} view. Handles user authentication via POST request and renders the login page on GET.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
On successful login, redirects to the home page.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
On failure, renders the login form with an error message.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}



\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{authenticate:get--logout-}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{GET~}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{/logout/}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Maps to the \sphinxtitleref{logout} view. Logs the user out and redirects to the login page.

\end{fulllineitems}



\section{authenticate.views module}
\label{\detokenize{authenticate:module-authenticate.views}}\label{\detokenize{authenticate:authenticate-views-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!authenticate.views@\spxentry{authenticate.views}}\index{authenticate.views@\spxentry{authenticate.views}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{login() (in module authenticate.views)@\spxentry{login()}\spxextra{in module authenticate.views}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{authenticate:authenticate.views.login}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{authenticate.views.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{login}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{request}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Handle user login.

\sphinxAtStartPar
If the request method is POST, it attempts to authenticate the user with the provided
username and password. On successful login, the user is redirected to the home page (‘tasks’).
If authentication fails, an error message is displayed.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
request (HttpRequest): The request object containing metadata about the request.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
HttpResponse: Renders the login page if the request is GET or if login fails.
Redirect: Redirects to the home page on successful login.

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{logout() (in module authenticate.views)@\spxentry{logout()}\spxextra{in module authenticate.views}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{authenticate:authenticate.views.logout}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{authenticate.views.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{logout}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{request}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Handle user logout.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Logs the user out and redirects to the login page.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
request (HttpRequest): The request object containing metadata about the request.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Redirect: Redirects to the login page after logout.

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}



\section{Module contents}
\label{\detokenize{authenticate:module-authenticate}}\label{\detokenize{authenticate:module-contents}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!authenticate@\spxentry{authenticate}}\index{authenticate@\spxentry{authenticate}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{task\_management package}
\label{\detokenize{task_management:task-management-package}}\label{\detokenize{task_management::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{task\_management} package serves as the main entry point for the task management project. It includes all the configurations, routing, and settings necessary for the application to function properly.


\section{Submodules}
\label{\detokenize{task_management:submodules}}

\section{task\_management.asgi module}
\label{\detokenize{task_management:task-management-asgi-module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module handles ASGI configurations for the Django application, enabling support for asynchronous features like WebSockets.
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!task\_management.asgi@\spxentry{task\_management.asgi}}\index{task\_management.asgi@\spxentry{task\_management.asgi}!module@\spxentry{module}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{task_management:module-task_management.asgi}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
ASGI config for task\_management project.

\sphinxAtStartPar
It exposes the ASGI callable as a module\sphinxhyphen{}level variable named \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{application}}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
For more information on this file, see
\sphinxurl{https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/4.2/howto/deployment/asgi/}


\section{task\_management.consumers module}
\label{\detokenize{task_management:task-management-consumers-module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Contains WebSocket consumers that handle real\sphinxhyphen{}time communication for the application, such as notifying users about task updates.

\section{task\_management.urls module}
\label{\detokenize{task_management:task-management-urls-module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module handles URL routing for the task management project.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{urlpatterns} list routes URLs to the appropriate views within the application. Below are the main routes configured:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Admin Interface}: Accessible at \sphinxtitleref{/admin/}, providing admin functionalities for managing the application.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Root URL}: Redirects to the login page, accessible at \sphinxtitleref{/}, which is set up using \sphinxtitleref{RedirectView}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Authentication URLs}: Routes for authentication views, such as login and logout, handled in the \sphinxtitleref{authenticate} app.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Tasks URLs}: Routes for task\sphinxhyphen{}related functionalities, such as creating, updating, and deleting tasks, managed in the \sphinxtitleref{tasks} app.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{OpenAI URLs}: Routes for integrating OpenAI functionalities, handled in the \sphinxtitleref{open\_ai} app.

\end{itemize}
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!task\_management.urls@\spxentry{task\_management.urls}}\index{task\_management.urls@\spxentry{task\_management.urls}!module@\spxentry{module}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{task_management:module-task_management.urls}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
URL configuration for task\_management project.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{The \sphinxtitleref{urlpatterns} list routes URLs to views. For more information please see:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxurl{https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/4.2/topics/http/urls/}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Examples:
Function views
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Add an import:  from my\_app import views

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Add a URL to urlpatterns:  path(‘’, views.home, name=’home’)

\end{enumerate}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Class\sphinxhyphen{}based views}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Add an import:  from other\_app.views import Home

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Add a URL to urlpatterns:  path(‘’, Home.as\_view(), name=’home’)

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxlineitem{Including another URLconf}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Import the include() function: from django.urls import include, path

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Add a URL to urlpatterns:  path(‘blog/’, include(‘blog.urls’))

\end{enumerate}

\end{description}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar
By default, the following models aren’t included:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
auto\sphinxhyphen{}created models for many\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}many relations without
an explicit intermediate table,

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
models that have been swapped out.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Set the corresponding keyword argument to True to include such models.
Keyword arguments aren’t documented; they’re a private API.

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{open\_ai.ollama\_phi module}
\label{\detokenize{open_ai:open-ai-ollama-phi-module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module defines the function to interact with the Ollama Phi3 model. It includes methods for sending user input and receiving responses.
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!open\_ai.ollama\_phi@\spxentry{open\_ai.ollama\_phi}}\index{open\_ai.ollama\_phi@\spxentry{open\_ai.ollama\_phi}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{get\_phi3\_response() (in module open\_ai.ollama\_phi)@\spxentry{get\_phi3\_response()}\spxextra{in module open\_ai.ollama\_phi}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{open_ai:module-open_ai.ollama_phi}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{open_ai:open_ai.ollama_phi.get_phi3_response}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{open\_ai.ollama\_phi.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_phi3\_response}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{user\_input}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Interacts with the phi3 model hosted by Ollama to generate a response based on user input.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
user\_input (str): The input text from the user.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
str: The formatted response from the phi3 model. If there is an error, returns an error message.

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{open\_ai.views module}
\label{\detokenize{open_ai:open-ai-views-module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module contains views for processing user input and interacting with the OpenAI API.


\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{open_ai:get--chatphi-}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{GET~}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{/chatphi/}}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{open_ai:get-Renders the chat interface for interacting with the Ollama Phi model.}}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\index{module@\spxentry{module}!open\_ai.views@\spxentry{open\_ai.views}}\index{open\_ai.views@\spxentry{open\_ai.views}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{chatphi() (in module open\_ai.views)@\spxentry{chatphi()}\spxextra{in module open\_ai.views}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{open_ai:module-open_ai.views}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{open_ai:open_ai.views.chatphi}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{open\_ai.views.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{chatphi}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{request}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Handles user input for the phi3 model and displays the response.

\sphinxAtStartPar
If the request method is POST, it extracts user input from the request, calls the \sphinxtitleref{get\_phi3\_response}
function to communicate with the phi3 model, and renders the \sphinxtitleref{ollama\_phi.htm} template with the model’s response.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
HttpResponse: Renders the \sphinxtitleref{ollama\_phi.htm} template with the model’s response and user input.

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{tasks package}
\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks-package}}\label{\detokenize{tasks::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{tasks} package handles all functionalities related to task management within the application. This includes task creation, updating, deletion, and representation.


\section{Subpackages}
\label{\detokenize{tasks:subpackages}}
\sphinxstepscope

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Suggest a name for the operations this migration might represent. Names
are not guaranteed to be unique, but put some effort into the fallback

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{unapply() (tasks.migrations.0001\_initial.Migration method)@\spxentry{unapply()}\spxextra{tasks.migrations.0001\_initial.Migration method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks.migrations:tasks.migrations.0001_initial.Migration.unapply}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{unapply}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{project\_state}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{schema\_editor}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{collect\_sql}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Take a project\_state representing all migrations prior to this one
and a schema\_editor for a live database and apply the migration
in a reverse order.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The backwards migration process consists of two phases:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The intermediate states from right before the first until right
after the last operation inside this migration are preserved.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The operations are applied in reverse order using the states
recorded in step 1.

\end{enumerate}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_models() (tasks.apps.TasksConfig method)@\spxentry{get\_models()}\spxextra{tasks.apps.TasksConfig method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks.apps.TasksConfig.get_models}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_models}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{include\_auto\_created}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{include\_swapped}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Return an iterable of models.

\sphinxAtStartPar
By default, the following models aren’t included:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
auto\sphinxhyphen{}created models for many\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}many relations without
an explicit intermediate table,

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
models that have been swapped out.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Set the corresponding keyword argument to True to include such models.
Keyword arguments aren’t documented; they’re a private API.

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{tasks.models module}
\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks-models-module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module defines the \sphinxtitleref{Task} model which represents tasks within the application.
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!tasks.models@\spxentry{tasks.models}}\index{tasks.models@\spxentry{tasks.models}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{Task (class in tasks.models)@\spxentry{Task}\spxextra{class in tasks.models}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:module-tasks.models}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks.models.Task}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tasks.models.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Task}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{*}\DUrole{n}{args}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{**}\DUrole{n}{kwargs}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Model}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Represents a task in the task management system.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Attributes:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
title (str): The title of the task.
description (str, optional): A detailed description of the task.
due\_date (datetime, optional): The date and time by which the task should be completed.
assigned\_to (User): The user to whom the task is assigned.
status (str): The current status of the task (Todo, Doing, Review, Done).
created\_at (datetime): The date and time when the task was created.

\end{description}

\index{\_get\_unique\_checks() (tasks.models.Task method)@\spxentry{\_get\_unique\_checks()}\spxextra{tasks.models.Task method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Return a list of checks to perform. Since validate\_unique() could be
called from a ModelForm, some fields may have been excluded; we can’t
perform a unique check on a model that is missing fields involved
in that check. Fields that did not validate should also be excluded,
but they need to be passed in via the exclude argument.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}one or
one\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

\sphinxAtStartPar
In the example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{Child}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Model}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{parent} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ForeignKey}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Parent}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{related\PYGZus{}name}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{children}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Child.parent}} is a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ForwardManyToOneDescriptor}} instance.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{refresh\_from\_db() (tasks.models.Task method)@\spxentry{refresh\_from\_db()}\spxextra{tasks.models.Task method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks.models.Task.refresh_from_db}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{refresh\_from\_db}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{using}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{fields}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{from\_queryset}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Reload field values from the database.

\sphinxAtStartPar
By default, the reloading happens from the database this instance was
loaded from, or by the read router if this instance wasn’t loaded from
any database. The using parameter will override the default.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Fields can be used to specify which fields to reload. The fields
should be an iterable of field attnames. If fields is None, then
all non\sphinxhyphen{}deferred fields are reloaded.

\sphinxAtStartPar
When accessing deferred fields of an instance, the deferred loading
of the field will call this method.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{save() (tasks.models.Task method)@\spxentry{save()}\spxextra{tasks.models.Task method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks.models.Task.save}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{save}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{*}\DUrole{n}{args}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{force\_insert}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{force\_update}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{using}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{update\_fields}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Save the current instance. Override this in a subclass if you want to
control the saving process.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The ‘force\_insert’ and ‘force\_update’ parameters can be used to insist
that the “save” must be an SQL insert or update (or equivalent for
non\sphinxhyphen{}SQL backends), respectively. Normally, they should not be set.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{save\_base() (tasks.models.Task method)@\spxentry{save\_base()}\spxextra{tasks.models.Task method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks.models.Task.save_base}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{save\_base}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{raw}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{force\_insert}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{force\_update}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{using}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{update\_fields}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Handle the parts of saving which should be done only once per save,
yet need to be done in raw saves, too. This includes some sanity
checks and signal sending.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The ‘raw’ argument is telling save\_base not to save any parent
models and not to do any changes to the values before save. This
is used by fixture loading.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{serializable\_value() (tasks.models.Task method)@\spxentry{serializable\_value()}\spxextra{tasks.models.Task method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks.models.Task.serializable_value}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{serializable\_value}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{field\_name}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Return the value of the field name for this instance. If the field is
a foreign key, return the id value instead of the object. If there’s
no Field object with this name on the model, return the model
attribute’s value.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Used to serialize a field’s value (in the serializer, or form output,
for example). Normally, you would just access the attribute directly
and not use this method.

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{tasks.serializers module}
\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks-serializers-module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module contains serializers for converting \sphinxtitleref{Task} model instances to JSON format and vice versa.
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!tasks.serializers@\spxentry{tasks.serializers}}\index{tasks.serializers@\spxentry{tasks.serializers}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{TaskSerializer (class in tasks.serializers)@\spxentry{TaskSerializer}\spxextra{class in tasks.serializers}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:module-tasks.serializers}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks.serializers.TaskSerializer}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tasks.serializers.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{TaskSerializer}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{*}\DUrole{n}{args}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{**}\DUrole{n}{kwargs}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ModelSerializer}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Serializer for the Task model.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This serializer is responsible for converting Task instances to JSON format 
and validating incoming data for Task creation and updates.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Meta:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
model (Task): The Task model to serialize.
fields (list): List of fields to include in the serialization.

\end{description}

\index{create() (tasks.serializers.TaskSerializer method)@\spxentry{create()}\spxextra{tasks.serializers.TaskSerializer method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks.serializers.TaskSerializer.create}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{validated\_data}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
We have a bit of extra checking around this in order to provide
descriptive messages when something goes wrong, but this method is
essentially just:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
return ExampleModel.objects.create({\color{red}\bfseries{}**}validated\_data)
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
If there are many to many fields present on the instance then they
cannot be set until the model is instantiated, in which case the
implementation is like so:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
example\_relationship = validated\_data.pop(‘example\_relationship’)
instance = ExampleModel.objects.create({\color{red}\bfseries{}**}validated\_data)
instance.example\_relationship = example\_relationship
return instance
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The default implementation also does not handle nested relationships.
If you want to support writable nested relationships you’ll need
to write an explicit \sphinxtitleref{.create()} method.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_default() (tasks.serializers.TaskSerializer method)@\spxentry{get\_default()}\spxextra{tasks.serializers.TaskSerializer method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_default}}}{}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Return the default value to use when validating data if no input
is provided for this field.

\sphinxAtStartPar
If a default has not been set for this field then this will simply
raise \sphinxtitleref{SkipField}, indicating that no value should be set in the
validated data for this field.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{many\_init() (tasks.serializers.TaskSerializer class method)@\spxentry{many\_init()}\spxextra{tasks.serializers.TaskSerializer class method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks.serializers.TaskSerializer.many_init}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{classmethod\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{many\_init}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{*}\DUrole{n}{args}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{**}\DUrole{n}{kwargs}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
This method implements the creation of a \sphinxtitleref{ListSerializer} parent
class when \sphinxtitleref{many=True} is used. You can customize it if you need to
control which keyword arguments are passed to the parent, and
which are passed to the child.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Note that we’re over\sphinxhyphen{}cautious in passing most arguments to both parent
and child classes in order to try to cover the general case. If you’re
overriding this method you’ll probably want something much simpler, eg:

\sphinxAtStartPar
@classmethod
def many\_init(cls, {\color{red}\bfseries{}*}args, {\color{red}\bfseries{}**}kwargs):
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
kwargs{[}‘child’{]} = cls()
return CustomListSerializer({\color{red}\bfseries{}*}args, {\color{red}\bfseries{}**}kwargs)
\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{run\_validation() (tasks.serializers.TaskSerializer method)@\spxentry{run\_validation()}\spxextra{tasks.serializers.TaskSerializer method}}

\index{set\_value() (tasks.serializers.TaskSerializer method)@\spxentry{set\_value()}\spxextra{tasks.serializers.TaskSerializer method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks.serializers.TaskSerializer.set_value}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{set\_value}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{dictionary}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{keys}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{value}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Similar to Python’s built in \sphinxtitleref{dictionary{[}key{]} = value},
but takes a list of nested keys instead of a single key.

\sphinxAtStartPar
set\_value(\{‘a’: 1\}, {[}{]}, \{‘b’: 2\}) \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} \{‘a’: 1, ‘b’: 2\}
set\_value(\{‘a’: 1\}, {[}‘x’{]}, 2) \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} \{‘a’: 1, ‘x’: 2\}
set\_value(\{‘a’: 1\}, {[}‘x’, ‘y’{]}, 2) \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} \{‘a’: 1, ‘x’: \{‘y’: 2\}\}

\end{fulllineitems}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Validate empty values, and either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Raise \sphinxtitleref{ValidationError}, indicating invalid data.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Raise \sphinxtitleref{SkipField}, indicating that the field should be ignored.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Return (True, data), indicating an empty value that should be
returned without any further validation being applied.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Return (False, data), indicating a non\sphinxhyphen{}empty value, that should
have validation applied as normal.

\end{itemize}

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{tasks.urls module}
\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks-urls-module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module defines the URL patterns for the tasks app.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{urlpatterns} list routes URLs to views. Below are the main routes configured:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{/}: Maps to the \sphinxtitleref{index} view which lists all tasks.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{/create\_task/}: Maps to the \sphinxtitleref{create\_task} view for creating new tasks.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{/update\_task/\textless{}int:id\textgreater{}}: Maps to the \sphinxtitleref{update\_task} view for editing existing tasks.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{/delete\_task/\textless{}int:id\textgreater{}}: Maps to the \sphinxtitleref{delete\_task} view for removing tasks.

\end{itemize}
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!tasks.urls@\spxentry{tasks.urls}}\index{tasks.urls@\spxentry{tasks.urls}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{urlpatterns (in module tasks.urls)@\spxentry{urlpatterns}\spxextra{in module tasks.urls}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:module-tasks.urls}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks.urls.urlpatterns}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tasks.urls.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{urlpatterns}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }{[}\textless{}URLPattern \textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{} {[}name=\textquotesingle{}tasks\textquotesingle{}{]}\textgreater{}, \textless{}URLPattern \textquotesingle{}create\_task/\textquotesingle{} {[}name=\textquotesingle{}create\_task\textquotesingle{}{]}\textgreater{}, \textless{}URLPattern \textquotesingle{}update\_task/\textless{}int:id\textgreater{}\textquotesingle{} {[}name=\textquotesingle{}update\_task\textquotesingle{}{]}\textgreater{}, \textless{}URLPattern \textquotesingle{}delete\_task/\textless{}int:id\textgreater{}\textquotesingle{} {[}name=\textquotesingle{}delete\_task\textquotesingle{}{]}\textgreater{}{]}}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
URL patterns for the tasks app.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Routes:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
/ : Maps to the \sphinxtitleref{index} view which lists all tasks.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
/create\_task/ : Maps to the \sphinxtitleref{create\_task} view for creating new tasks.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
/update\_task/\textless{}int:id\textgreater{} : Maps to the \sphinxtitleref{update\_task} view for editing existing tasks.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
/delete\_task/\textless{}int:id\textgreater{} : Maps to the \sphinxtitleref{delete\_task} view for removing tasks.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}



\section{tasks.views module}
\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks-views-module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module contains the view functions for handling requests related to tasks.
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!tasks.views@\spxentry{tasks.views}}\index{tasks.views@\spxentry{tasks.views}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{create\_task() (in module tasks.views)@\spxentry{create\_task()}\spxextra{in module tasks.views}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:module-tasks.views}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks.views.create_task}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tasks.views.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_task}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{request}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Handles the creation of new tasks.

\sphinxAtStartPar
If the request method is POST, validates and saves the new task. 
It also invalidates the cache and notifies WebSocket clients about the new task.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns:}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{HttpResponse: Redirects to the tasks index page on success, or re\sphinxhyphen{}renders }
\sphinxAtStartPar
the create task form with error messages on failure.

\end{description}

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{delete\_task() (in module tasks.views)@\spxentry{delete\_task()}\spxextra{in module tasks.views}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks.views.delete_task}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tasks.views.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{delete\_task}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{request}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{id}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Handles the deletion of a task.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Checks if the user has permission to delete the task. If the task is found, 
it deletes the task and invalidates the cache. If the task does not exist, 
or the user lacks permissions, it returns an appropriate error message.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object.
id (int): The ID of the task to be deleted.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns:}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{HttpResponse: Redirects to the tasks index page after deletion or }
\sphinxAtStartPar
shows an error message if deletion fails.

\end{description}

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{index() (in module tasks.views)@\spxentry{index()}\spxextra{in module tasks.views}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks.views.index}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tasks.views.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{index}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{request}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Displays the list of tasks.

\sphinxAtStartPar
If the request method is GET, retrieves tasks from the cache or database
and renders the index.html template with the tasks data.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
HttpResponse: Renders the index.html template with the tasks.

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{update\_task() (in module tasks.views)@\spxentry{update\_task()}\spxextra{in module tasks.views}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tasks:tasks.views.update_task}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tasks.views.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{update\_task}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{request}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{id}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Handles the update of an existing task.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Retrieves the task by ID and renders the update form. If the request method is POST,
validates and saves the updated task data. Informs WebSocket clients about the task update.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object.
id (int): The ID of the task to be updated.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns:}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{HttpResponse: Redirects to the tasks index page on successful update,}
\sphinxAtStartPar
or re\sphinxhyphen{}renders the update form with error messages on failure.

\end{description}

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{templates}
\label{\detokenize{templates:templates}}\label{\detokenize{templates::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This section includes the HTML templates used in the authenticate app.


\section{create.html}
\label{\detokenize{templates:create-html}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{create.html} template is used for creating a new object.


\section{update.html}
\label{\detokenize{templates:update-html}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{update.html} template is used for updating an object.


\section{index.html}
\label{\detokenize{templates:index-html}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{index.html} template is the main index page.


\section{login.html}
\label{\detokenize{templates:login-html}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{login.html} template is used for user login.

\label{\detokenize{templates:ollama-phi-html}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
